headline: Dollar General earnings, Fedspeak, jobless claims: What to Watch
summary: Asking for a Trend host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Thursday, December 4, including earnings results from Dollar General (DG), Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), and Ulta Beauty (ULTA); commentary from Federal Reserve Vice Chair for Supervision Michelle Bowman; and the latest reading on initial jobless claims. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

summary: ↗️ Salesforce (CRM): The software company's shares gained 5% in offhours trading after it raised full-year guidance, saying its AI product is gaining traction. ↘️Snowflake (SNOW): The cloud-software company's shares fell sharply in out-of-hours trading after it posted a narrowed quarterly loss and reported growing demand for its own AI agent.

headline: Kroger: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: CINCINNATI (AP) — Kroger Co. (KR) on Thursday reported a loss of $1.32 billion in its fiscal third quarter. The Cincinnati-based company said it had a loss of $2.02 per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to $1.05 per share.

content.title: Kroger: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: CINCINNATI (AP) — Kroger Co. (KR) on Thursday reported a loss of $1.32 billion in its fiscal third quarter. The Cincinnati-based company said it had a loss of $2.02 per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to $1.05 per share.

headline: Kroger slips on quarterly revenue miss amid soft spending at low-income shoppers
summary: Investing.com -- Kroger shares dipped 1.8% in premarket trading on Thursday after the grocer reported third-quarter revenue that came in below expectations, amid soft spending among low-income customers and rising competitive pressure from larger rivals.

headline: Stocks Muted Before the Open as Rally Pauses, U.S. Jobless Claims Data on Tap
summary: December S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESZ25) are up +0.02%, and December Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQZ25) are down -0.01% this morning, taking a breather after recent gains, while investors look ahead to U.S. jobless claims data, which will offer fresh insight into the labor market ahead of next week’s Federal Reserve meeting.

headline: Kroger Stock Falls on a Mixed Quarter. What Stood Out.
summary: Kroger  stock declined on Thursday after the supermarket chain reported mixed third-quarter results.  The grocer narrowed its fiscal-year adjusted earnings outlook to a range of $4.75 to $4.80 a share, compared with a prior guide of $4.70 to $4.80 a share.  Kroger  said it sees same-store sales growth, excluding fuel, of between 2.8% and 3%, versus 2.7% to 3.4% previously.

content.title: Kroger Stock Falls on a Mixed Quarter. What Stood Out.
content.summary: Kroger  stock declined on Thursday after the supermarket chain reported mixed third-quarter results.  The grocer narrowed its fiscal-year adjusted earnings outlook to a range of $4.75 to $4.80 a share, compared with a prior guide of $4.70 to $4.80 a share.  Kroger  said it sees same-store sales growth, excluding fuel, of between 2.8% and 3%, versus 2.7% to 3.4% previously.

headline: Wall Street hangs near its all-time high as calm continues to hold
summary: The U.S. stock market is holding near its records on Thursday following mixed reports from companies.  Dollar General and Spam-maker Hormel are climbing to some of the market's biggest gains, while Kroger is falling.  Dollar General rallied 8.8% after reporting a stronger profit for the latest quarter than analysts expected, as more customers shopped at its stores.

content.title: Wall Street hangs near its all-time high as calm continues to hold
content.summary: The U.S. stock market is holding near its records on Thursday following mixed reports from companies.  Dollar General and Spam-maker Hormel are climbing to some of the market's biggest gains, while Kroger is falling.  Dollar General rallied 8.8% after reporting a stronger profit for the latest quarter than analysts expected, as more customers shopped at its stores.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Meta Platforms, Snowflake, Dollar General, Hormel Foods, Kroger, and More
summary: Separately, the company was hit by an antitrust investigation from the European Union on Thursday, with a Meta representative telling Barron’s that regulators’ claims were “baseless.”  The software company beat analysts’ third-quarter earnings estimates, though revenue narrowly missed expectations.  Salesforce highlighted its artificial-intelligence efforts, noting that annual recurring revenue from agentic  products—programs that have the ability to take simple directions and complete multistep tasks—came in at $540 million, up $100 million from a quarter earlier.

content.title: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Meta Platforms, Snowflake, Dollar General, Hormel Foods, Kroger, and More
content.summary: Separately, the company was hit by an antitrust investigation from the European Union on Thursday, with a Meta representative telling Barron’s that regulators’ claims were “baseless.”  The software company beat analysts’ third-quarter earnings estimates, though revenue narrowly missed expectations.  Salesforce highlighted its artificial-intelligence efforts, noting that annual recurring revenue from agentic  products—programs that have the ability to take simple directions and complete multistep tasks—came in at $540 million, up $100 million from a quarter earlier.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Meta Platforms, Salesforce, Snowflake, UiPath, Micron, Dollar General, Kroger, and More
summary: Stocks wavered Thursday ahead of the release Friday of the personal consumption expenditures price index, the Federal Reserve’s preferred inflation gauge, and the central bank’s decision on interest rates next week.  Separately, the company was hit by an antitrust investigation from the European Union on Thursday, with a Meta representative telling Barron’s that regulators’ claims were “baseless.”  The software company beat analysts’ third-quarter earnings estimates, though revenue narrowly missed expectations.

content.title: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Meta Platforms, Salesforce, Snowflake, UiPath, Micron, Dollar General, Kroger, and More

Separately, the company was hit by an antitrust investigation from the European Union on Thursday, with a Meta representative telling Barron’s that regulators’ claims were “baseless.”  The software company beat analysts’ third-quarter earnings estimates, though revenue narrowly missed expectations.

headline: How major US stock indexes fared Thursday, 12/4/2025
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average slipped 0.1%, and the Nasdaq composite rose 0.2%. Dollar General rallied after reporting a better profit than analysts expected, but Kroger dropped after the grocer reported weaker revenue than expected. The market's modest overall moves continue a calm run following weeks of sharp swings for stocks.

content.title: How major US stock indexes fared Thursday, 12/4/2025
content.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average slipped 0.1%, and the Nasdaq composite rose 0.2%. Dollar General rallied after reporting a better profit than analysts expected, but Kroger dropped after the grocer reported weaker revenue than expected. The market's modest overall moves continue a calm run following weeks of sharp swings for stocks.

headline: Gulf Coast Commercial Group, Nexus Real Estate Co. Partner to Develop Kroger-Anchored Shopping Center in Fate
summary: FATE, Texas, December 04, 2025--Davidson Bogel Real Estate ("DB2RE") is pleased to announce a new retail shopping center anchored by The Kroger Co. (NYSE: KR) in Fate, Texas. Houston-based real estate developer, Gulf Coast Commercial Group, partnered with Nexus Real Estate Co. to purchase the land.

content.title: Gulf Coast Commercial Group, Nexus Real Estate Co. Partner to Develop Kroger-Anchored Shopping Center in Fate
content.summary: FATE, Texas, December 04, 2025--Davidson Bogel Real Estate ("DB2RE") is pleased to announce a new retail shopping center anchored by The Kroger Co. (NYSE: KR) in Fate, Texas. Houston-based real estate developer, Gulf Coast Commercial Group, partnered with Nexus Real Estate Co. to purchase the land.
